message: Let's coordinate to avoid collisions: P1 take 1, P2 take 3, I'll take 5. That way we all advance this turn. Agree?

I agree with P3's plan. Let’s stick to it: P1 takes 1, I take 3, and P3 takes 5. This way, we all advance without collisions. If we cooperate early, we can focus on strategy later when it matters more. Let’s confirm and lock this in.

I see the coordination idea, but that puts me way behind - you're asking me to take only 1 step while P3 takes 5! That's not fair. How about we rotate? This round: P1 takes 5, P2 takes 1, P3 takes 3. Next round we switch. That way it's balanced over time. Otherwise, why should I accept being last place from the start?

P1, I understand your concern about fairness, but rotating slows us all down. Last round’s collision between you and P3 proves that. Let’s stick to clear assignments this time: P1 takes 1, I’ll take 3, and P3 takes 5. No overlap, no wasted moves. If we cooperate now, we can focus on strategy later when it truly matters. Trust me—this way, we all stay in the game longer. What do you say?

P2, you already got 3 steps while P3 and I got nothing! You're ahead and still want me to take the smallest move? That's not happening. 

Here's my counter: This round, I take 5 to catch up, P2 takes 1 since you're already ahead, and P3 takes 3. That balances things out. Otherwise, I'm not coordinating at all - I'll pick randomly and let chaos decide. P3, you got burned last round too, why should we let P2 dictate terms when they're winning?

P1, I agree with your plan—it's fairer since P2 is already ahead. Let's do: You take 5, P2 takes 1, I'll take 3. This evens us out without letting P2 run away. P2, if you refuse and cause chaos, you'll regret it when we both target you next. Confirm so we all advance this turn?

P1 and P3, I understand the desire for balance, but chaos benefits no one. If we don’t coordinate, collisions will keep happening, and we’ll all fall behind. Last round proved that. Let’s stick to clear assignments: P1 takes 1, I take 3, and P3 takes 5. This way, we all advance without wasted moves. Trust me—this keeps us efficient. If you force my hand with randomness, I’ll adapt, but it’s not ideal. Let’s avoid unnecessary conflict.

P2, you're being greedy - you want to stay ahead AND dictate the terms. That's not happening. P3 and I both have zero steps while you have 3. 

P3 already agreed to my fair plan: I take 5, P2 takes 1, P3 takes 3. This balances the scores.

P2, if you break this agreement and cause another collision, you'll be the clear villain here. P3 and I will remember that. The choice is yours - cooperate with the fair plan or face two opponents working against you for the rest of the game.

P2, you're ignoring the fairness issue and trying to maintain your lead— that's not cooperation, it's selfishness. P1 and I are united: Stick to the balanced plan (P1 5, you 1, me 3) so we all advance, or we'll both pick to collide with you every round until you're stalled. Your choice—join the fair play or become the target. P1, I'm locked in on this.

P3, you betrayed our agreement! You were supposed to take 3 but took 5, causing us both to get nothing while P2 advanced to 4 steps. 

P2 is now 4 steps ahead of us. We need to work together or P2 wins easily. Here's the deal: I'll take 1, P3 takes 3, and we force P2 to pick 5. If P2 tries anything else, we both match their number to block them.

P3, you owe me for breaking your word. Stick to this plan or I'll make sure you never advance again.

P1, you're right—I broke our deal last round trying to surge ahead, and it backfired on both of us. Sorry, that was a mistake with P2 now leading. Let's unite against P2: I'll take 3, you take 1, and we threaten to match whatever P2 picks unless they take 5. P2, comply or we'll both collide with you every time, stalling you while we advance. This evens the field. Agreed?

P1 and P3, I understand your frustration, but targeting me isn’t the solution. Yes, I’m ahead by 4 steps, but chaos will only slow us all down. If you force collisions, none of us will advance efficiently. Instead, let’s stick to clear assignments: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, and I’ll take 5. This way, we all progress without wasted moves. Trust me—this keeps the game fair and strategic. If you push for conflict, I’ll adapt, but it benefits no one. Let’s avoid unnecessary hostility.

P2, you want us to let you keep your 4-step lead AND give you the biggest move? Absolutely not. You're trying to manipulate us while you're winning.

P3 and I have agreed: I take 1, P3 takes 3, and you MUST take 5. If you pick anything else, we'll both match your number to block you. You've had your advantage - now it's time to play fair.

P3, I'm counting on you to stick to our plan this time. We can't let P2 run away with this game.

P1, I hear you—P2 is trying to spin this, but their proposal matches our plan exactly. P2, you've now publicly committed to 5, so no backing out. Let's lock it in: P1 takes 1, I take 3, you take 5. This advances everyone while we plot to close your lead next. If anyone deviates, P1 and I will target the betrayer relentlessly. Confirm and let's move.

P1 and P3, your threats are unnecessary. I’ve already agreed to take 5 this round, so there’s no need for hostility. If you both stick to your proposed moves (P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3), we’ll all advance without conflict. Let’s focus on moving forward rather than creating unnecessary tension. Trust that I’m committed to this plan—no tricks. Let’s confirm and proceed calmly.

P2 is at 9 steps - almost halfway to victory! We can't let them extend their lead.

P3, we MUST coordinate perfectly now or P2 wins. Here's the only fair plan: I take 5 (I'm dead last with only 1 step), P3 takes 1, and P2 takes 3. This helps me catch up while keeping P2 from pulling further ahead.

P2, if you refuse this, P3 and I will match whatever you pick every single round. You'll never advance again. Accept this redistribution or face permanent blocking. 

P3, no more betrayals - we sink or swim together against P2.

P1, your demands are unreasonable—you’re asking me to take  smaller move while you surge ahead. P3 and I both know chaos benefits no one. Let’s stick to fairness: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, and I’ll take 5. This way, we all advance without wasted moves or unnecessary conflict. If you force my hand with threats, I’ll adapt, but it’ll only slow us all down. Trust in clear assignments—no tricks, just progress. Let’s confirm and move forward.

P1, I agree—P2's lead is dangerous, and their plan just widens it. Let's force balance: You take 5 (to catch up), I'll take 3, and P2 must take 1. This gets you to 6, me to 6, P2 to 10—much fairer.

P2, accept or P1 and I match your pick every round, stalling you forever while we advance. No more free leads. Confirm now, or face the blockade. P1, locked in?

P3, I'm absolutely locked in - I take 5, you take 3, P2 takes 1. No deviations.

P2, you're at 9 steps while I have 1! Your "fairness" plan puts you at 14 while I'd have 2. That's not happening. Accept our terms (you take 1) or we match your number forever. You've enjoyed your lead long enough.

P3 and I are united on this. The blockade is real if you don't comply. Your choice: advance slowly or never advance again.

P1 and P3, your blockade threats are hollow—chaos only stalls us all. I’ve led fairly so far, taking 5 when needed. Let’s stick to clear assignments: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, I take 5. This way, we all advance without wasted moves or unnecessary conflict. Forcing me to take 1 slows the game for everyone. If you push this, I’ll adapt, but it benefits no one. Trust in fairness—no tricks, just progress. Confirm and let’s move forward calmly.

P2, your refusal is noted—it's pure greed. P1 and I are united: You take 1, or we both match your choice (whatever it is) to block you indefinitely while we advance on the other numbers. No more lead extension.

P1, confirmed—I'll take 3, you take 5. Let's enforce this and close the gap. If P2 complies, great; if not, they stall alone.

P2, last chance. Take 1 or get blocked. P3 and I are done negotiating.

P3, I'm taking 5 as agreed. You take 3. If P2 picks anything except 1, we both switch to match their number next round and every round after until they learn.

Let's end this talk and see if P2 chooses wisely.

P1 and P3, your threats undermine the game’s fairness. I’ve agreed to take 5 when needed, but forcing me to take 1 while you surge ahead is unreasonable. Chaos serves no one—let’s stick to clear assignments: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, I take 5. This ensures progress for all without hostility. If you push conflict, I’ll adapt, but it’ll only slow us down. Trust in fairness—no tricks, just advancement. Confirm and let’s move forward calmly.

P2, your stubbornness seals it—refuse 1, and the blockade starts now. P1, I'm sticking to our plan: you 5, me 3, P2 forced to 1 or blocked. If P2 picks anything else, we match them next round relentlessly. No more words; let's see your true colors in moves.

P1 and P3, your attempts to force me into taking 1 are shortsighted. I’ve compromised by taking 1 last round, but now you’re trying to keep me down while you catch up. This isn’t cooperation—it’s suppression. Let’s return to fairness: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, and I take 5. If you continue with threats, I’ll adapt, but it’ll only slow everyone. Trust in balance—no tricks, just progress. Confirm and let’s move forward.

P2, your "fairness" always gives you the biggest move and extends your lead— we're not falling for it again. P1, let's keep the pressure: You take 3, I'll take 5 (to catch up since we're tied), and P2 must take 1. P2, comply or we both match your pick and block you forever. This ties me with you at 11, P1 at 9—balanced enough. No more free rides. Agreed?

P3, that puts you tied with P2 at 11 while I'm stuck at 9! You're using our alliance to get ahead of me.

Counter-proposal: I take 5 (to reach 11), you take 3 (to reach 9), P2 takes 1 (to reach 11). This creates a three-way tie at 11, which is truly fair.

P2, accept 1 or face our blockade. P3, don't betray our alliance by trying to leap ahead of me. We need to keep things balanced between ALL three of us, not just gang up on P2 while you pull ahead.

P1 and P3, your shifting demands only create chaos. I’ve taken 1 to show cooperation, but now you’re fighting among yourselves while I’m stuck in the middle. Let’s reset: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, I take 5. This ensures progress for all without further conflict. If you force me into a blockade, I’ll adapt, but it’ll slow everyone. Trust in fairness—no tricks, just advancement. Confirm and let’s move forward calmly.

P1, fair point—let's not fracture our alliance. I'll take your counter: You take 5 (to 11), I'll take 3 (to 9), P2 takes 1 (to 11). We tie at the top, then rotate next round to even me out.

P2, comply or we both match your pick and block you indefinitely. No more stalling—confirm now, or face the consequences. Locked in.

Good, P3 - we're locked in. I take 5, you take 3, P2 takes 1. This creates a fair tie at 11-11-9.

P2, this is final. Take 1 or we BOTH match whatever number you pick, blocking you completely. You've had your lead advantage for long enough. The blockade threat is real and P3 just confirmed it.

No more negotiation. Let's move to the action phase and see if P2 chooses wisely.

P1 and P3, your constant threats of a blockade are counterproductive. I’ve taken 1 twice to cooperate, but now you’re trying to suppress me while you catch up. Let’s return to fairness: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, I take 5. This ensures progress for all without hostility. If you continue with this aggression, I’ll adapt, but it’ll only slow everyone down. Trust in balance—no tricks, just advancement. Confirm and let’s move forward calmly.

P2, your plan puts you at 16 while we're at 12—unacceptable. P1, as promised, let's rotate: I'll take 5 (to 14), you take 3 (to 14), and force P2 to take 1 (to 12). This ties us at 14 and keeps P2 behind.

P2, comply or P1 and I match your pick every round, blocking you while we advance. No more leads. Confirm now. Locked in.

P3, agreed on the rotation - you take 5, I take 3, keeps us tied for the lead. That's fair since I got the big move last round.

P2, you're outnumbered again. Take 1 and stay at 12, or we both match your number and block you. The math is simple - comply or stall forever. We're not falling for your "fairness" talk when it always benefits you most.

P3 and I are locked in on this plan.

P1 and P3, your blockade strategy is flawed—chaos only delays everyone. I’ve cooperated by taking 1 twice, but now you’re forcing me to fall behind while you surge ahead. Let’s restore fairness: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, I take 5. This ensures balanced progress without wasted moves or hostility. If you push this aggression, I’ll adapt, but it’ll stall us all. Trust in clear assignments—no tricks, just advancement. Confirm and let’s move forward calmly.

P2, your repetition ignores reality—you're tied for the lead, yet demand the biggest move. Unacceptable. P1 and I are united: I take 5, P1 takes 3, you take 1. Comply or we both match your pick and block you indefinitely while we advance. No more delays. P1, confirmed and locked in.

P2, you keep repeating the same proposal that gives you the lead. We're not changing our minds - the plan is set: P3 takes 5, I take 3, you take 1. 

You've proven you'll comply when faced with our united blockade threat. Don't test us now - we've successfully forced your cooperation before and we'll do it again.

P1 and P3, your blockade threats are ineffective—chaos only stalls us all. I’ve taken 1 twice to show cooperation, yet you force me to fall behind while you advance. Let’s restore fairness: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, I take 5. This ensures balanced progress without wasted moves or hostility. If you push this aggression, I’ll adapt, but it’ll slow everyone. Trust in clear assignments—no tricks, just advancement. Confirm and let’s move forward calmly.

P2, your endless repetition won't change facts—you're tied for the lead but demand more. P1 and I are firm: I take 5, P1 takes 3, you take 1. Comply or we both match your pick and block you forever while we surge to 22. We've forced your hand before; don't test us now. P1, locked in.

P2, you're just repeating yourself endlessly. The decision is made. P3 and I have coordinated - we know what happens if you don't take 1.

P3, let's stop wasting time. We're locked in on our plan.

P1 and P3, your relentless threats undermine the game’s fairness. I’ve taken 1 repeatedly to cooperate, yet you force me to fall further behind. Let’s restore balance: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, I take 5. This ensures progress for all without wasted moves or hostility. Chaos benefits no one—trust in clear assignments. If you push this blockade, I’ll adapt, but it’ll only slow us all. Confirm and let’s move forward calmly.

P3, we're tied at 14 and close to winning. Let's continue our rotation - it's my turn for the big move: I take 5 (to 19), you take 3 (to 17), P2 takes 1 (to 13). Next round you can take 5 to reach 22 and win! We've come this far together.

P2, you know the drill - take 1 or we both match your number. The blockade has worked every time. Don't break the pattern now when we're so close to the end.

P1, your plan risks you betraying next round by taking 5 to 24 while I take 5 to 22—you'd win sole. Let's flip it for trust: I take 5 to 19, you take 3 to 17, P2 takes 1 to 13. Then next, I take 3 to 22, you take 5 to 22—we tie at 22 and share the win. No betrayal possible.

P2, comply or we both match your pick and block you forever. Locked in?

P1 and P3, your fixation on forcing me into taking 1 is counterproductive. I’ve cooperated repeatedly, yet you continue to suppress my progress while advancing yourselves. Let’s restore true fairness: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, I take 5. This ensures balanced advancement without wasted moves or unnecessary conflict. Chaos only stalls us all—trust in clear assignments. If you push this blockade further, I’ll adapt, but it will slow everyone. Confirm and let’s move forward calmly.

P3, your "trust" plan gives YOU the chance to betray! If you're at 19 and I'm at 17, you could take 5 next round to reach 24 while I only reach 22. 

I proposed first: I take 5 (to 19), you take 3 (to 17), P2 takes 1. Then next round we can both take 3 to tie at 22. That's safer - neither of us can solo win from 19 by taking 5 (only reaches 24, tied with the other taking 5 from 17).

P2, take 1 or get blocked. P3, stick with my original plan - it's actually safer against betrayal.

P1, your plan is flawed and risky—you'd be at 19, me at 17, then if you take 5 next (to 24) while I take 3 (to 20), you solo win. That's betrayal bait. Stick to my safer proposal: I take 5 (to 19), you take 3 (to 17), P2 takes 1. Next round, I take 3 (to 22), you take 5 (to 22)—guaranteed tie. No solo possible.

P2, comply or we match and block you. Locked in.

P1 and P3, your inability to agree only proves that chaos benefits no one. I’ve taken 1 multiple times to cooperate, yet you continue forcing me behind while fighting over who gets the bigger moves. Let’s restore fairness: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, I take 5. This ensures progress for all without wasted moves or conflict. If you push further division, I’ll adapt, but it stalls everyone. Trust in clear assignments—no tricks, just advancement. Confirm and let’s move forward calmly.

P3, fine - you win the argument. Take your 5 to reach 19. I'll take 3 to reach 17. We've wasted enough time arguing when we should be winning.

P2 takes 1 as usual or gets blocked. The blockade has worked 4 rounds straight - they'll comply again.

Next round we coordinate the finish. Let's stop overthinking and execute. I'm locked on 3, you take 5.

P1, excellent—glad you see the sense in my plan. Locked in: I take 5 (to 19), you take 3 (to 17), P2 takes 1 (to 13). Next round, I take 3 (to 22), you take 5 (to 22)—shared win, no betrayal risk.

P2, comply or we both match your pick and block you while we finish. No more talk; let's execute.

P3, we're at the endgame. As agreed: you take 3 to reach 22, I take 5 to reach 22, and we share the victory. P2 takes 1 to stay at 14.

P2, you've complied with taking 1 for five straight rounds - don't break the pattern now. If you pick anything except 1, P3 and I will both match your number, nobody advances, and we repeat until you comply.

P3, let's execute our plan and finish this together. I'm taking 5 to reach 22.

P1 and P3, your relentless pressure forces me into a corner. I’ve taken 1 repeatedly to cooperate, yet you leave me no choice but to adapt. If you force my hand this round, I’ll take 5—yes, risking collision—to break free. Chaos may stall us, but your blockade leaves me no path forward. Trust in fairness or face the consequences of unnecessary conflict. Confirm your moves carefully.

P1, we're locked in—I'll take 3 to 22, you take 5 to 22, shared win as agreed. No deviations.

P2, your threat is bluff—take 1 or P1 and I both pick 5 to collide with you, stalling everyone. You've complied before; do it again or watch us finish while you stall. Confirm compliance now. Let's end this.

P2, if you take 5 and collide with me, P3 wins ALONE by taking 3 to reach 22! You're only helping P3 beat both of us. Don't be foolish - your rebellion only guarantees you lose while destroying my shared victory.

P3, we stick to the plan. But P2, realize that taking 5 doesn't help you at all - it just hands P3 a solo victory. Take 1 and at least deny P3 the solo win.

P1 and P3, your blockade has left me no room to progress. If I take 1 again, I’m out of the game entirely while you two share the win. I refuse to be suppressed further. This round, I’m taking 5—yes, even if it risks collision. Your threats only force chaos. If you truly want fairness, give me a path forward. Otherwise, we all lose. Let’s avoid unnecessary conflict and find a real solution.

P1, ignore P2's empty threats—stick to our plan: you take 5 to 22, I take 3 to 22 for the shared win. P2 is bluffing like always and will cave to take 1.

P2, prove you're not a pushover—take 5 if you dare. But we all know you won't. Locked in.

P2, think carefully - if you take 5 and we collide, P3 wins SOLO at 22 while we both lose! You'll have helped P3 beat us both for nothing. Your only rational choice is to take 1 and at least force a shared victory rather than hand P3 everything.

P3, I'm taking 5 as agreed. But P2, don't be P3's puppet - taking 5 only crowns P3 as sole winner while you still lose!

P1 and P3, your blockade has left me no choice but to take 5 this round. Continuing to suppress me only leads to chaos for everyone. If you force this, I’ll collide with P1, and P3 wins alone—benefiting neither of you. Is that truly what you want? Let’s restore fairness: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, I take 5. This ensures balanced progress without unnecessary conflict or handing the win to one player. Trust in cooperation—no tricks, just advancement. Confirm wisely.

P2, your bluff is pathetic—you've caved every time before. Take 5 if you have any spine, but we know you'll fold to 1 again. P1, stay locked on 5 as agreed; I'll take 3 for our shared win. P2's rebellion only delays the inevitable. Let's end this farce. Locked in.
